questions.question: What does development mean?

choices.answer: A term that measures people's standard of living.
A term that measures the ages of people.
A term that measures the amount of people that can read.
A term that measures the amount of pets people have.

questions.question: Which of the following would help a country develop?

choices.answer: If we invest in corrupt police officers
If literacy rate rises as job prospects improve
If literacy rate rises as then people eat less
If we invest in men's education instead of women's.

questions.question: What does food security mean?

choices.answer: When too much food is produced so it gets thrown away
When too much food is produced so people eat too much
When not enough food is produced because people eat too much
When not enough food is being produced to meet consumption

questions.question: Which of the following is a development indicator?

choices.answer: Human development index
Average garden size
Average inner leg length
Size of babies being born

questions.question: Which of the following is a development indicator?

choices.answer: Average amount of pets
Amount of wood chopped down
Gross Domestic Product
Amount of shoes owned

questions.question: What are the three components of HDI?

choices.answer: GDP per capita, life expectancy and time spent in education
GDP per capita, Infant mortality rate, life expectancy
Life expectancy, infant mortality rate, birth rate
Time spent in education, life expectancy, death rate

questions.question: What does GDP mean?

choices.answer: The total value of goods produced by a country
The total value of goods and services produced by a country
The total value of services produced by a country
The total value of a countries exports

questions.question: Which area of the UK has the highest GDP per capita?

choices.answer: Scotland
South West
East midlands
London and the South East

questions.question: Which of the following is a factor affecting inequality in the UK?

choices.answer: The amount of shoes people have
How many friends people have
The income of people in an area
The amount of trees in a place

questions.question: What is international aid?

choices.answer: When one country sells oil to another country
Where one country voluntarily transfers resources to another
When one country sells natural gas to another country
When one country helps another country fight a war

questions.question: What does FDI stand for?

choices.answer: Free direct intelligence
Fabulous drinking initiative
Foreign direct input
Foreign direct investment

questions.question: What is foreign direct investment?

choices.answer: When a company invests in a company in a different country
When a company invests in a company in the same country
When a country invests in education and health
When a country  invests in its infrastructure

questions.question: What is top down development?

choices.answer: Development projects led by the local community
Development projects lead by charities
Development projects led by government or TNCs
Development projects led by schools

questions.question: Which is an example of top-down development?

choices.answer: Local water pumps
A dam
Sewage pipes
New railway lines

questions.question: What is bottom up development?

choices.answer: Development projects that need sophisticated technology
Development projects that are really expensive
Development projects led by the government
Development projects led by the local community

questions.question: We have studied development in an emerging country, which one?

choices.answer: South Africa
India
Brazil
China

questions.question: What does economic core mean?

choices.answer: the most economically advanced regions
the least economically advanced regions
the regions with the highest population
the regions with the lowest population

questions.question: Which are examples of India's economic core?

choices.answer: Punjab
Bihar
Maharashtra
Goa

questions.question: What does periphery mean?

choices.answer: regions with lower development
regions with highest development
regions with lots of persian cats
regions that are most economically advanced

questions.question: Which is an example of a periphery region in India?

choices.answer: Chandigarh
Bihar
Maharashtra
Goa

questions.question: Which of the following is a job in the primary sector?

choices.answer: Farmer
Factory worker
Doctor
Teacher

questions.question: What do people in the secondary sector do?

choices.answer: Provide services
Extract raw materials from the land/sea
Provide information services
Manufacture raw materials

questions.question: How has India's tertiary sector changed?

choices.answer: It is decreasing, less people are working in this sector.
It is not changing.
It is increasing, more people are working in this sector.
It is increasing which is causing more air pollution.

questions.question: Which statement is true about the quaternary sector?

choices.answer: It is causing increases in air pollution
Over 1 million new ICT jobs have been created
Increase mechanisation means farming is decreasing
It is decreasing

questions.question: Which are India's key exports?

choices.answer: Rice, coffee, pineapple
oil products, gems and jewellery
oil products, avocado and bananas
crude oil, gold and silver

questions.question: What has happened to India's population?

choices.answer: It has increased from 782 million in 1985 to 7 billion.
It has decreased from 1.3 billion in 1985, to 782 million.
It has increased from 300 million to 300 billion.
It has increased from 782 million in 1985, to 1.3 billion.

questions.question: How has India's population structure changed?

choices.answer: There are more people under 15 years old.
People are dying younger
There are less people under 15 years old.
There are less people between 15-64 years old

questions.question: What has happened to India's life expectancy?

choices.answer: It has stayed the same and is 54 years.
It has decreased from 54 in 1985 to 50 years.
It has increased from 54 years in 1985 to 89.
It has increased from 54 years in 1985 to 68.

questions.question: Why has India had disputes with Pakistan?

choices.answer: Because of Kashmir.
Because Russia is supplying India with missiles.
Because India want more control over the Indian ocean.
Because Canada is giving India uranium.

questions.question: Why is India in competition with China?

choices.answer: Because of Kashmir
Because Russia is providing India with missiles.
Because India wants more control over the Indian ocean.
Because Canada is providing India with uranium

questions.question: Which of the following is an environmental impact of India's rapid development?

choices.answer: Increases in tourism
Larger workforce
Potential to invest in renewable energy
Better access to healthcare

questions.question: Which of the following is a social impact of India's rapid development?

choices.answer: Increase CO2 emissions
Cost of installing new infrastructure
Cost of providing more services
Lack of housing leading to slums

questions.question: Which of the following is an economic impact of India's rapid development?

choices.answer: Logging and land clearance
Better access to healthcare
pressure and cost of providing more services
Pollution in cities leading to poor public health

questions.question: Which is true about India's international aid?

choices.answer: As India has developed, international aid has increased.
As India has developed, international aid has not changed.
As India has developed, international aid has decreased.
India has never received international aid

questions.question: What is private investment?

choices.answer: Investment by TNCs or smaller businesses
Investment by the government
